Title: Data Scientist - AI Factory - F/M/NB
HTML:
Cegid is a European leader in cloud business management solutions for finance (cash-flow, tax, ERP), human resources (payroll, talent management), CPAs, retail and entrepreneurial sectors. In today’s rapidly changing world, Cegid & its 4,400 employees make more possible by helping their 500,000 customers unleash their potential thanks to innovative and purposeful business solutions.

Make more possible, is our vocation. It reflects who we are, how and why we do things the way we do them for our clients. Thanks to this, we can affirm that we work every day to shape your future, ours and our clients’ industries’ future. A future we have been defining for years with our employees, by inventing solutions that change the way people work, for a sustainable performance.

@AI Factory

The AI Factory is dedicated to advancing our management software through AI innovation. Our primary goal is to seamlessly integrate AI features into our product line, either by enhancing functionality and user experience or by recreating user workflows to take full advantage of AI technology.

Your Main Objectives As a Data Scientist

You will play a pivotal role in advancing our data science capabilities, developing machine learning models, focusing on building robust models that enhance decision-making processes and drive business intelligence.

As a Data Scientist, You Will

  • Lead the design, development, and implementation of machine learning models tailored for finance and accounting applications;
  • Explore and develop generative AI models to address challenges and opportunities in the finance and accounting domain;
  • Collaborate with finance and accounting experts, software engineers, and data engineers to integrate machine learning solutions into existing systems;
  • Demonstrate an interest in and familiarity with MLOps tools and practices to streamline the deployment, monitoring, and management of machine learning models.
  • Advanced degree (MSc or PhD) in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline;
  • Proven experience (4+ years) in developing and deploying machine learning models, preferably in the finance and accounting domain;
  • Strong programming skills in languages such as Python or R, familiarity with MLOps tools and practices;
  • Experience with generative AI models and/or NLP is a plus.



We are not just looking for professional skills, we're also looking for talents who want to express their potential and open up new possibilities with us ! Above all, it's your curiosity, team spirit and sense of customer service that will make the difference.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Your responsibilities




We’re looking for a Python Developer (F/M/D) with a passion for building robust back-end services to join our team and contribute to the development of our web-based product: the AI-powered CELUS Engineering Platform, which automates the electronics engineering process and significantly reduces development time. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Python development and a commitment to seamless user experiences. In this role you will:




Participate in the development of the back-end web applications and REST APIs, leveraging your existing web development experience.
Write efficient, readable, and maintainable Python code, embracing challenging tasks that extend beyond conventional Python API development.
Interact with a wide variety of tasks, from building APIs to coming up with clever business logic.
Interface and team up with other areas of engineering to solve diverse back-end problems, from third-party integrations to data modelling.




Your profile




3+ years of Python experience, including familiarity with Python web frameworks, preferably FastAPI, pydantic
Competence in using pytest and linters to ensure code quality
Knowledge of ORM on python and databases, MongoDB and SQL preferred
Ability to write highly legible code, using design patterns and generally accepted best practices
Knowledge of micro-service architecture is highly advantageous but not essential
Fluent in written and spoken English
Agile-mindset and solution driven way of thinking
Fluent in written and spoken English




We offer:

Shape the future

Have a direct impact on the electronics industry with our agile and international team.




Feel welcome

Enjoy our startup atmosphere and get to know the CELUS team at regular team events and our annual company offsite.




Lunch on us

Enjoy meal allowance, with a Coverflex card, which can be used in restaurants, supermarkets, food delivery services within the VISA network.




Stay healthy

Benefit from Private Health Insurance through the leading health insurance brand in Portugal, ensuring peace of mind for your well-being.




Learn and develop

Improve your skills with our learning platforms, English/Portuguese language classes, trainings and workshops.




Decide where and when you work

Enjoy hybrid office environment with home office allowance, flexible working schedule, “workation” program, 24 vacation days plus additional paid Christmas week holiday.




ABOUT US

CELUS simplifies and accelerates the electronics design process for the global engineering community with it’s AI-powered CELUS Design Platform.




We are a Munich founded start-up on a mission to unleash scalable engineering by providing a comprehensive library of electronics components and CUBOs, automating all the manual and tedious tasks in the design process, so engineers can spend more time on innovation.




Join our community of tech enthusiasts and proactive high performers in an amazing journey through the world of electronics. We work with a clear vision, empowered by an ambitious, fast-paced environment and caring atmosphere, where your ideas and contributions are highly valued. We have offices in Munich, Germany; and Porto, Portugal; and Austin, Texas, USA.




Embracing diversity is a very important value at CELUS. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression.

Show more
HTML:
Your responsibilities


We’re looking for a Python Developer (F/M/D) with a passion for building robust back-end services to join our team and contribute to the development of our web-based product: the AI-powered CELUS Engineering Platform, which automates the electronics engineering process and significantly reduces development time. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Python development and a commitment to seamless user experiences. In this role you will:


  • Participate in the development of the back-end web applications and REST APIs, leveraging your existing web development experience.
  • Write efficient, readable, and maintainable Python code, embracing challenging tasks that extend beyond conventional Python API development.
  • Interact with a wide variety of tasks, from building APIs to coming up with clever business logic.
  • Interface and team up with other areas of engineering to solve diverse back-end problems, from third-party integrations to data modelling.


Your profile


  • 3+ years of Python experience, including familiarity with Python web frameworks, preferably FastAPI, pydantic
  • Competence in using pytest and linters to ensure code quality
  • Knowledge of ORM on python and databases, MongoDB and SQL preferred
  • Ability to write highly legible code, using design patterns and generally accepted best practices
  • Knowledge of micro-service architecture is highly advantageous but not essential
  • Fluent in written and spoken English
  • Agile-mindset and solution driven way of thinking
  • Fluent in written and spoken English


We offer:

Shape the future

Have a direct impact on the electronics industry with our agile and international team.


Feel welcome

Enjoy our startup atmosphere and get to know the CELUS team at regular team events and our annual company offsite.


Lunch on us

Enjoy meal allowance, with a Coverflex card, which can be used in restaurants, supermarkets, food delivery services within the VISA network.


Stay healthy

Benefit from Private Health Insurance through the leading health insurance brand in Portugal, ensuring peace of mind for your well-being.


Learn and develop

Improve your skills with our learning platforms, English/Portuguese language classes, trainings and workshops.


Decide where and when you work

Enjoy hybrid office environment with home office allowance, flexible working schedule, “workation” program, 24 vacation days plus additional paid Christmas week holiday.


ABOUT US

CELUS simplifies and accelerates the electronics design process for the global engineering community with it’s AI-powered CELUS Design Platform.


We are a Munich founded start-up on a mission to unleash scalable engineering by providing a comprehensive library of electronics components and CUBOs, automating all the manual and tedious tasks in the design process, so engineers can spend more time on innovation.


Join our community of tech enthusiasts and proactive high performers in an amazing journey through the world of electronics. We work with a clear vision, empowered by an ambitious, fast-paced environment and caring atmosphere, where your ideas and contributions are highly valued. We have offices in Munich, Germany; and Porto, Portugal; and Austin, Texas, USA.


Embracing diversity is a very important value at CELUS. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for an Python Developer!




Responsabilities:

Code and test software components and parts assigned to them for the technical domains under their responsibility in compliance with development and security norms and standards.
Help in the design, model and implementation of the product’s solution, as necessary, with the objective of optimize the quality of the code and its future maintainability.
Participate in the delivery of the product components in the different environments, in close collaboration with other teams whenever necessary.
Act as a reference in the function and capitalize on the gathered experience to share knowledge, train and coach others.




Requirements:

Experience with Python Programming.
Experience with Flask / Fast API.
Experience with SQL.
Experience with Javascript.
Experience with Angular.
Experience with Knowledge of Java.
Ability to collaborate / Teamwork.
Attention to detail/rigor.
Ability to synthetize / simplify.
Proactivity.
Critical Thinking
Good level of English.




If you’re interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference “CA/Python".




Thank You! 😊




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: AI Data/MLOps Engineer (f/m/div.)
Description:
The Bosch Group has more than 400 000 employees around the world, present in 60 countries, and we are proud to impact people’s lives and to work towards a more sustainable future.



Bosch Car Multimedia, S.A. belongs to the Automotive Electronics division and is focused on making the vehicles our third living space. About 3.600 associates are committed to develop and produce high quality technology that shape change in mobility worldwide. The company' success lies in its highly specialized and innovative team, and on the technological know-how which makes Bosch the leading supplier in the automotive market.



At Bosch, we shape the future by inventing high-quality technologies and services that spark enthusiasm and enrich people’s lives. Our promise to our associates is rock-solid: we grow together, we enjoy our work, and we inspire each other. Join in and feel the difference in mindsets, cultures, generations, identities and perspectives. Everyone should bring their authenticity and work together respectfully. Bosch is an employer that values diversity and equal opportunities. We welcome applications from people with disabilities and we can provide reasonable accommodations during the recruitment process and in the performance of professional activity. By including everyone and ensuring equal opportunities we unleash our full potential.





Job Description



Your contribution to something big:



Data Models & Data Pipelines:



Design, implement and/or integrate existing on-prem data pipelines, and make it available for the development of ML features



Collaborate in designing and running data acquisition activities, including ingestion from recording campaigns and synthetic data providers



Drive data consistency and synchronization efforts across different persistence systems in the data and ML loop



MLOps Strategy & Architecture:



Collaborate on the MLOps strategy for our hybrid cloud environment, ensuring alignment with business objectives, security requirements, and best practices



Collaborate on the technical design of a MLOps platform that provides a self-service approach to the MLOps loop problems, such as data ingestion, feature engineering, model training, model validation, model deployment, model monitoring



Hybrid ML-loop Implementation:



Design and implement Infrastructure as Code (IaC) solutions for provisioning and managing cloud and on-premises resources using Terraform



Implement robust security measures to protect sensitive Data and ML models in both cloud and on-premises environments



Implement and/or integrate tools to deliver the full MLOps loop



Collaboration & Leadership:



Work closely with data scientists, software engineers, and infrastructure teams to deliver a high-quality MLOps solution



Provide technical leadership and mentorship to junior engineers



Communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels, including technical and non-technical audiences





Qualifications



Education:



MSc or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning or a related field



Experience:



3+ years of experience in MLOps, Data Engineering or similar roles, with a strong focus on AI/ML use-cases

Technical Skills:



Proven experience designing, implementing, integrating, and maintaining Data infrastructure and MLOps solutions
Strong knowledge of Cloud solutions, preferably Azure
Experience with on-premises infrastructure management, including server management, networking, and storage
Experience with containerization and orchestration tools like Docker, Kubernetes, and Apache Airflow
Strong scripting and automation skills, such as Python and Bash
Strong understanding of DevOps principles and practices
Experience with CI/CD pipelines, preferably GitHub Actions
Proficiency in IaC tools, preferably Terraform

Soft Skills:



Excellent problem-solving skills
Effective communication skills, team player, and capable of collaborating across functional areas
Proactive, customer and result-oriented personality
Fluent in English, written and spoken
Experience working in Agile/SAFe environments


Additional Information



Work includes:



⚖️ Flexible work conditions



🔀 Hybrid work system



🌐 Exchange with colleagues around the world



🧑‍⚕️ Health insurance and medical office on site (psychology and general clinic)



📚 Training opportunities (p.e., technical training, foreign languages training) & certifications



📈 Opportunities for career progression and continuous professional development



💲 Access to great discounts in partnerships and Bosch products



🏋️ Sports and health related activities



🚉 Great access to public transports



🚌 Free transport from Porto



💰 Flexible benefits platform



🅿️ Free parking lot



🍽️ Canteen







Success stories don´t just happen. They are made...



Make it happen! We are looking forward to your application!



Show more

  • Effective communication skills, team player, and capable of collaborating across functional areas

  • Experience working in Agile/SAFe environments

🏋️ Sports and health related activities

🚌 Free transport from Porto

Title: Data Scientist - SAS & Python Specialist
Description:
Empowered by our motto, "Making Data Matter", Keyrus stands at the forefront of global consultancy in Data & Analytics, AI & Machine Learning, and Digital Transformation. With a presence in 27 countries across 4 continents, we're on a mission to elevate the impact of data.

We are data experts, guiding our clients through their data journey regardless of their level of maturity in analytics. As an end-to-end partner, we address varied challenges that our clients face, from Advanced Analytics, Cloud, Data Governance, Visualisation to Enterprise Performance Management, from advisory to delivery.

With more than 3200 employees in all corners of the world, Keyrus is dedicated to helping businesses taking advantage of the Data and Digital paradigm to enhance their performance, facilitating, and accelerating their transformation, and generating new drivers of growth, competitiveness, and sustainability.

Job Summary 




Keyrus is seeking a Data Scientist - SAS/Python Specialist to join a critical data transformation initiative, supporting the migration of legacy SAS processes to a modern, scalable Python-based platform. You will play a key role in designing, developing, and optimising data pipelines, ensuring performance, scalability, and alignment with business requirements.

Location: Portugal (Might require On-site attendance).
Start date: September 




Note: All applications/CV’s must be submitted in English.




Key Responsibilities

Lead and contribute to the migration of data workflows from SAS to Python, ensuring functionality and performance are maintained or improved
Design and implement robust Python solutions tailored to business and technical needs
Optimise existing data pipelines and develop new algorithms for improved efficiency and scalability
Collaborate closely with data engineers, analysts, and project stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver production-ready solutions
Troubleshoot, debug, and resolve technical issues in Python processes
Document code, migration strategies, and technical solutions to support knowledge sharing and long-term maintainability




Requirements for the role 


5+ years of experience with Python, preferably in senior or lead roles
Strong background in PySpark or Scala for distributed data processing tasks
Solid knowledge of SQL, data structures, and algorithm optimisation techniques
Hands-on experience with SAS, especially SAS Data Integration Studio
Proven experience mentoring or guiding junior team members
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP is a plus
Nice to have: Understanding of data warehousing concepts and ETL best practices
Fluent in English
Must be a Portuguese or European citizen or have a work permit for Portugal

 

What we offer at Keyrus Portugal:

Competitive salary based on your skills & experience and according to the Data market practice
Meal allowance of €8.32 per day
Flexible benefits option
Private Medical Insurance
22 days of annual leave (increasing every 3 years up to a maximum of 25 days)
Training Program through KLX (Keyrus Learning Experience) Platform


Why Keyrus?


Joining Keyrus means joining a market leader in the Data Intelligence field and an (inter)national player in Management Consultancy and Digital Experience.

Keyrus Portugal operates on five guiding pillars that shape our approach to work and collaboration – Diversity; Trust; Flexibility; Ownership & Innovation - we're dedicated to cultivating a team as diverse as the challenges we take on. 

We embrace and celebrate the rich variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and talents that each individual brings. We firmly believe that diversity fuels innovation, ignites creativity, and propels us towards greatness. 

Regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other dimension of diversity, everyone is not only welcome but valued here. 

Join us in shaping a future where everyone can thrive!

Title: Desenvolvedor Python
Description:
At ALTEN, we are certain that the success of our projects is due to the people who make up our team. That’s why, if you have at least 3 years of experience as a Python Developer we are committed to boosting your talent, meeting your professional expectations, and making you feel right at home. Do you want to build the world of tomorrow today? Keep reading!




Job Description and Main Tasks:

Primary goal will be to continually improve the core framework used for data integration and calculation of Market and Counterparty Risk Metrics.
Innovation is a key element of Risk Systems, so candidates will have the opportunity to collaborate in cross-team innovative projects and propose initiatives aligned with our top innovation priorities
Develop and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Python code
Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems
Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the applications
Ensure code documentation and organization
Incrementally deliver applications to meet dynamic customer requirements
Resolve incidents in a production environment
Collaborate with different stakeholders in the solution of problems and blockages




Skills:




Python
Experience with SQL and any industry standard relational database
Demonstrable ability to write clean and readable code
Solid understanding of both object-oriented and functional programming paradigms
Understanding fundamental design principles behind a scalable application
Advanced English







What can we offer you?

Joining a competitive, multinational company that is constantly growing.
Integration into a highly qualified team of professionals with a great work environment—innovative and dynamic.
Specialized training and ongoing professional development.
Social benefits.
Competitive salary.




Who are we?

We are a team. We are part of ALTEN, a European multinational specializing in providing consulting, information technology, and engineering services to the leading companies in the Portuguese market.

If you like numbers, we can tell you that in Portugal we have 2 headquarters, and a team of 2.500 professionals.

Moreover, at ALTEN, we take pride in offering equal opportunities regardless of gender, age, abilities, or country of origin. Our commitment is to talent and to the people who possess it.

Title: MLOPS Engineer
Description:
A PrimeIT é uma empresa de referência, com mais de 17 anos de experiência na prestação de serviços tecnológicos de IT, Telecomunicações e Engenharia. Especializados em Team Extension, Managed Services, Custom Software e Nearshore, contamos actualmente com uma equipa de mais de 2350 profissionais que colaboram em projectos nacionais e internacionais nas mais diversas tecnologias.

Estamos à procura de MLOPS Engineer para projecto!

O que procuramos?

Experiência enquanto MLOPS engineer
Inglês Fluente
Disponibilidade para regime hibrido no Porto
Proficiência em linguagens de programação como Python, com experiência prática em frameworks de machine learning como TensorFlow, PyTorch ou Scikit-learn.
Conhecimentos em pipelines de CI/CD, ferramentas de automação e sistemas de controlo de versões como o Git.

O que oferecemos?

Integração numa empresa de dimensão internacional com presença em mais de 50 cidades no mundo;
Formação constante nas mais recentes e inovadoras tecnologias – Prime Academy;
Acompanhamento e progressão de carreira.




📩 Envia o teu CV para bafonso@primeit.pt e junta-te à equipa Prime!

Title: Python Backend Developer (HYBRID @PORTO)
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: PYTHON Developer

Seniority: 4+

Type of position: Hybrid (2x/week at Porto Office)




The amazing you, will have:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
4+ years of experience in software development with Python, with a strong background in backend development.
Strong knowledge of object-oriented programming principles, design patterns, and software engineering best practices.
Comfortable working with SQL and No-SQL Databases.
Basic knowledge of the Linux command line.
Experience with Clouds, Rest API’s and Microservices Architectures.
DevOps mindset (CI/CD knowledge) and experience with tests.
Understanding of software development methodologies, such as Agile or Scrum, and experience working in collaborative development environments.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to quickly understand and debug complex software applications.
Availability for a hybrid regime at Porto (Portugal).
Fluency in English is mandatory.







To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you´ll have (plus):

Related Certifications.







Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefer the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psychologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!




Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Innovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Computer Vision Engineer
Description:
The Tribe




"Prozis is a powerhouse product developing company. Every day we make new products. That is only possible because we developed our own proprietary technology that ensures that we bring you high quality, beautiful and fair priced products. We endure in our philosophy of a 4.0 vertical process, manufacturing in our own facilities or with the help of our super partners. We do everything: idea, concept, design, manufacturing, quality control, marketing, sales, logistics, printing, distribution, client support, software development, photo, video, 3D and philosophy. We deliver wherever you are, whenever you want. We don’t compromise. We breathe technology, drink design and feed on our will to exceed ourselves making the best products in the world. This all starts in 2007 with a crazy guy in a garage that thinks he can change the world for the better. Right now, we are hundreds, going to thousands of crazy but focused people. Will is a skill. There is a lot of people that want to buy us out. We don’t have a F****** price tag. It’s not about the money. It’s about our mission. Trust us. We will feed your body and mind with everything you need to exceed yourself."

- miguel milhão




The Team




You probably don't know, but we have a secret and incredible team that develops our electronic projects and takes on impressive and mind-blowing challenges. It might be hard to believe they are hidden in plain sight, but trust us when we say they make magic happen.

Now, we are looking for a Computer Vision Engineer to join this mission and master the art of interpreting the world through images. If you can create prototypes and test innovative concepts in artificial intelligence and computer vision and data processing to solve complex problems—then you are the one!




The Job




As a Computer Vision Engineer, you will:




Create prototypes and test innovative concepts in the field of artificial intelligence and computer vision.
Develop neural networks and implement advanced deep learning techniques.
Create algorithms to interpret the world with images;
Analyze and combine expertise in statistics, machine learning and data processing to solve complex problems;
Work with point cloud processing and 3D imaging.




Are you ready for this? Then you're the person we're looking for!




You




We're looking for someone with a degree in Eletronics Engineering (or a related field) and have hands-on experience in similar projects. You need to have programming experience, particularly in C++ and Python, and knowledge of object-oriented development. You should be comfortable working with frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch or OpenCV, as well as using libraries such as NumPy and Pandas.




Your Superpowers:




Strong familiarity with computer vision techniques and data processing.
Experience in developing algorithms for tasks like object detection;
Knowledge of deep learning model applications;
Expertise in processing point clouds and 3D images;
Autonomy;
Ability to work under great pressure;
Creative problem-solving skills to find solutions when others don't work;




If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you! Join us and be part of a dynamic team that values innovation and excellence.




Btw, Prozis is not for everyone.




Nos termos da Política de Recrutamento do grupo PROZIS, a pessoa portadora de deficiência, nos termos da Lei n.º 38/2004, de 18/08, cuja candidatura não tenha sido admitida ou respondida no prazo de 30 dias, tem a faculdade de pedir a fundamentação da decisão e a sua reavaliação através de pedido apresentado no canal de denúncias constante de www.prozis.com, na categoria "direitos e protecção dos indivíduos".

Title: Research Scientist – Asymmetric Hybrid Supercapacitors
HTML:
Job Reference: Ref.29.25.408

Employer: International Iberian Nanotechnology Laboratory (INL)

Location: Braga, Portugal

Group/Unit: Muñoz Research Group

Number of Vacancies: 1

Employment Type: Full time

Contract Duration: 16 months


Open Date for Applications: May 6th, 2025

Closing Date for Applications: August 11th, 2025, 23h00m (Lisbon Time)


Key words: #supercapacitors #electrochemistry #celldesign


Overview

The Muñoz RG conducts both fundamental and application-oriented research on materials and devices for energy storage and conversion. We are looking for a qualified Research Scientist to join our team and work under the project HEADsupercap


Job Duties

The job duties will be the following:

  • Perform the R&D activities as planned in the EU project HEDAsupercap for development of asymmetric hybrid supercapacitors;
  • Collaborate with other academic and industry partners within the consortium on joint R&D;
  • Report to supervisor on R&D and team progress;
  • Project reporting;
  • Publish project results and communicating the results in project/professional meetings;
  • Engage in other project dissemination activities;
  • Prepare project proposals;
  • Keep a safe laboratory environment.


Mandatory Qualifications


Education

  • PhD in Electrochemistry, Materials Chemistry, Materials Science and Engineering, Nanotechnology, or other related field.


Experience and Technical Skills

  • Profound knowledge on materials development for energy storage;
  • Relevant experience with supercapacitors;
  • Extensive knowledge of capacitor chemistry and electrochemical performance assessment;
  • Experience with implementing safety protocols;
  • Experience supervising other researchers.



Other Valued Skills

  • Experience in European project management;
  • Capacity to execute research plans with strict timeline and deadlines;
  • Data management and observation of dissemination protocols;
  • Waste management;
  • Experience with materials scale-up.


Personal Skills

  • Supervision of other team members and teamwork;
  • Good communication skills;
  • Problem-solving abilities;
  • Ability to propose and develop new project ideas;
  • “Hands-on” approach together with a high commitment in respecting working deadlines.



Our Benefits

  • Competitive salary;
  • Tax benefits and other Diplomatic privileges;
  • Private health insurance;
  • Family allowances (according to family situation);
  • Free nursery service at INL premises (subject to availability);
  • Support for education fees of dependent children;
  • Relocation support;
  • 30 working days of annual leave.



How to Apply

The application must be in English and include the following mandatory documents:

  1. Cover letter
  2. Curriculum Vitae
  3. Academic and/or Professional diplomas
  4. At least one reference letter


Online application instructions:

  1. The application is made online by clicking the “Apply” button;
  2. The candidate must complete all required sections of the online application form;
  3. The candidate must submit the mandatory documents mentioned above in pdf format by including them in the “Additional files” section using the “Add portfolio” button.


Important note:

Incomplete applications including the failure to provide mandatory documents or providing inaccurate information will result in the application not being considered.



How the Selection Process works


A. Applications eligibility check

This stage will be carried out on the basis of the mandatory requirements, education, experience and technical skills defined for the job, as well as the validation of the mandatory documents. Only candidates who meet the eligibility criteria will move forward to the next stage.


B. CV Assessment

The Selection Committee will evaluate the eligible applications based on their CV and other submitted documents and the suitability for the position. The best ranked candidates will be shortlisted for the interview stage(s).


C. Interview(s)

The interview(s) may be done in different formats: video recording, online or onsite.

The question based interview will evaluate the match between the candidate’s profile and the requirements for the position, including the technical and personal skills. To better support this stage, the candidate may be requested to prepare a short presentation.


D. Nomination

The selected candidate will be nominated and formally offered the position, including the disclosure of the contractual conditions.




Additional Information



Application feedback

We highly value your interest in becoming part of the INL experience and it is important for us to maintain good communications with all candidates. No matter the outcome of your application, we will always provide you with feedback.


Equal Opportunity and Non-Discrimination Principle

INL follows a non-discrimination and equal access principle, wherefore no candidate can be privileged, benefited, impaired or deprived of any rights whatsoever, or be exempt of and duties based on any possible discriminatory issues.


The advertisement deadline may be extended at any time without previous notice in order to improve the suitability and effectiveness of the recruitment process.



About INL

The International Iberian Nanotechnology Laboratory – INL (http://www.inl.int), is the first and only Intergovernmental Organisation in the world entirely focused on Nanoscience and Nanotechnology.

It was founded under an international legal framework to perform interdisciplinary research, deploy and communicate nanotechnology for the benefit of society. INL aims to be a recognised leading global nanotechnology innovation hub.

Title: Senior Research Scientist
HTML:
🚀 The Company

Nutrium is a health tech company transforming how people engage with nutrition on a global scale. For years, we’ve improved the experience of nutrition professionals and patients with today’s #1 nutrition counseling platform. But we didn’t stop there.

Today, our mission extends further. With Nutrium Care, we aim to make real nutrition accessible to everyone - promoting healthier and happier lives.

Our journey is fueled by core values that guide every decision we make. We believe that everyone can make an impact, regardless of their job title or experience. We embrace continuous improvement, experiment with new ideas, and learn from both successes and mistakes. We value teamwork and collaboration in pursuit of shared goals, and above all, we strive for excellence.

👏 The Team

We are a motivated, young, and entrepreneurial team, driven by the excitement of building something meaningful.

At Nutrium, we value creativity, communication, agility, and being provocatively kind - sometimes the best way to help is by challenging others with empathy. While expertise is important, what truly sets us apart is our willingness to embrace challenges that others might avoid.

About the role:

At Nutrium, we’re on a mission to improve lives through personalized nutrition. As Senior Research Scientist, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping and driving our strategy for creating robust clinical evidence that demonstrates the impact of Nutrium on people’s health and well-being.

You’ll be focused on designing and executing high-quality research studies — including randomized controlled trials — to prove the efficacy of Nutrium’s solutions. You’ll spearhead projects in nutritional health while also contributing to day-to-day activities such as data analysis, manuscript writing, and the clear communication of scientific evidence to our customers, partners, and the broader community.

If you’re passionate about nutrition, health tech, and preventive care — and ready to grow in a dynamic, fast-moving team — we’d love to hear from you!

Are you ready?

Key responsibilities:

  • Define and lead Nutrium’s clinical research strategy in alignment with our mission and business goals;
  • Design and coordinate research studies (e.g., RCTs, cross-sectional surveys, pre-post studies) on topics such as nutrition, metabolic health, and workplace interventions;
  • Manage clinical projects from planning to reporting, in collaboration with internal teams and external research partners;
  • Analyze large datasets, perform statistical analysis, and report findings (e.g., white papers, return on investment reports, case studies…);
  • Write scientific articles for peer-reviewed journals and create presentations for internal and external audiences;
  • Build partnerships with universities, institutions, insurers, and domain experts;
  • Conduct rigorous literature reviews and create scientific content to support product, clinical, and marketing teams;
  • Oversee translation and localization of research materials for international markets.


Who you are:

  • PhD or Postdoc in Public Health, Epidemiology, Behavioural Science, or related fields (focus on Nutritional Health is a strong plus);
  • 5+ years of experience leading research studies or clinical trials, ideally in Health Tech, MedTech, or fast-paced environments;
  • Skilled in designing and delivering research projects in collaboration with B2B partners;
  • Solid knowledge of clinical trial processes, documentation, and regulatory principles;
  • Comfortable working with nutritional interventions and evaluating outcomes like dietary change, quality of life, or productivity;
  • Strong data analysis skills using Python or R (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, StatsModels, Matplotlib, etc.);
  • Familiar with tools like Excel, SPSS, and CTMS, or document management systems;
  • Proven track record of publications in peer-reviewed journals related to nutrition or workplace health;
  • Excellent communicator, able to collaborate across diverse teams and engage with stakeholders;
  • Well-organized, reliable, and experienced in supporting research operations (e.g., budgets, admin tasks);
  • Passionate about nutrition, employee wellbeing, and healthcare innovation;
  • Fluent in English (Portuguese or Spanish is a plus!).

Title: Junior Software Developer
HTML:
We are looking for a Junior Software Scientist to join our team. The primary focus of this role is to develop and maintain web scraping pipelines in Go (Golang), while also contributing to general backend development efforts. You will work on extracting data from diverse web sources, ensuring robustness, performance, and scalability. This is an excellent opportunity for someone passionate about data acquisition, backend systems, and solving real-world problems through automation and clean code.


What you will be doing:


  • Design, implement, and maintain web scraping pipelines using Go;
  • Ensure reliability and scalability of scraping systems and manage scraping infrastructure;
  • Develop and support backend systems that integrate with other services (APIs, databases, etc.);
  • Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to understand data needs and deliver structured datasets;
  • Monitor, debug, and optimize scraping jobs and backend workflows for performance and efficiency;
  • Handle challenges such as anti-bot systems, rate limits, and data deduplication;
  • Participate in system architecture discussions and help shape technical direction;
  • Write clean, well-documented, and tested code that adheres to industry best practices.


Requirements:


  • Background in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related technical field;
  • Past programming contact with Go (Golang) or williness to learn;
  • Understanding of HTTP, HTML parsing, and web protocols;
  • Familiarity with concurrent programming, APIs, and RESTful services;
  • Past contact with databases (SQL and/or NoSQL);
  • Basic knowledge of containerization (e.g., Docker) and CI/CD tools is a plus;
  • Critical thinker with an appetite for automation and process improvement;
  • Able to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment;
  • Fluent in English, both written and spoken.


Perks:


  • Flexible Hybrid Work System;
  • 15th Month Bonus Salary Policy;
  • 4 extra vacation days;
  • Participation in International Projects;
  • Company-Paid Certifications;
  • Training, career progression and support;
  • Team Building Activities,
  • Innovative & Young Culture.


Location:


We’re based in Porto, Portugal. Although there is the possibility of remote working, we are only considering people located in Portugal.

Title: Junior Developer
HTML:
Retail Consult is recruiting!

The impact of technology in retail is a game changer affecting every retailer from small, local shops to retail giants.

Working at Retail Consult means being at the center of this industry in transformation.

As specialists in technology solutions for retail, we provide solutions strategy, implementation, deployment, training, and support services for clients across a range of retail segments including fashion, grocery, pharmacy, do it yourself, telecommunications, and electronics.

Work, train and learn with a growing team with over 300 people based in Portugal, the US, Germany, Brazil, Mexico, Chile and China, who are transforming the business of retailers across the globe.

We are currently seeking forJunior Developersto join our growing delivery team in Porto, Portugal.

What We Are Offering

The opportunity to be part of a team responsible to Implement solutions in world-wide reference companies;

The opportunityto join a growing company with people passionate about their work in an international environment;

The opportunityto work with best-in-breed methodologies, tools and techniques;

Training and Mentoring/Talent Development programs;

Full package ofSalary, perks, and benefits (Health Insurance, mobile allowance, and others);

Career Evolution, tailored for your profile and aspirations;

Flexibleworking hours;

Extra days off;

Wellbeing program;

Partnerships with local businesses;

What We Are Looking For

University Degree in Information Systems, Information Technology, Systems Engineering or similar;

Academic experience with databases and programming languages, such as SQL Server, MySQL, PL/SQL, Java, etc;

Analytical Skill to interpret and understand business processes by written requirements and technical specification documents;

Good communication skills, problem solving mindset;

Adaptable, flexible attitude and resilient to perform well under pressure;

Ability to workwell within a team with several seniority levels;

Availability totravel;

Proficiency in English.

Requirements

If you think your profile matches our requirements and you are looking for an experience that offers opportunity, growth, balance, and a feeling of value, apply to this job submitting your CV at:

/ or ******.

Retail Consult– Transforming Retail with Passion

Title: Senior/Lead Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description:
It's more than a job

In this IT role, you will manage, develop, and support the technology infrastructure that powers Kuehne+Nagel’s global systems and operations. This contribution is vital to making both special and ordinary moments in the lives of people a reality. In fact, your work enables our teams to deliver fresh fruit, time-sensitive healthcare products and much more to people all around the world. Working in IT at Kuehne+Nagel contributes to more than we imagine.

‎

Join a highly innovative and agile team of data scientists, data engineers, and software developers based in Hamburg, Porto, and Wrocław to shape the next generation of data-driven logistics. As a Senior/Lead Data Scientist in the corporate AI team, you will design and implement world-class AI solutions for automation, decision-making, and optimization using the latest technologies. We are looking for a candidate who combines deep expertise in AI and software development with a passion for solving domain-specific challenges.

How you create impact


Design and implement our AI solutions using state-of-the-art AI technologies.
Shape the entire lifecycle of AI applications – from ideation and exploration to specification, architectural design, prototyping, production implementation and enterprise-wide integration.
Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to identify new opportunities.
Mentor more junior team members by sharing technical and domain expertise.
Uphold high engineering standards through code reviews and technical guidance.
Take an active role in project coordination and roadmap planning.


What we would like you to bring


Master’s or PhD degree in data science, computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, physics or a related field.
Two years of experience as a Senior Data Scientist or in an equivalent role.
Capability to envision and deliver end-to-end data-driven solutions.
Advanced hands-on experience in AI model development with strong proficiency in machine learning frameworks. Familiarity with large language models (LLMs), retrieval augmented generation (RAG) and agent-based systems is a plus.
Proficiency in Python with proven software architecture and development skills in enterprise environments.
Experience with data pipelines, workflow orchestration, APIs and databases. Practical experience with deployment, CI/CD pipelines and cloud platforms is a plus.
Experience mentoring team members and consulting with business stakeholders.
Excellent communication skills in spoken and written English paired with a collaborative mindset.


What's in it for you

Join Kuehne+Nagel’s IT Hub in Porto or Wrocław and make a real impact on the digital transformation of our logistics enterprise. Here, you will find a hybrid work model, extensive health benefits, and a culture of continuous learning that ensures your career growth. You’ll be surrounded by extraordinary and committed people, all dedicated to shaping the future of logistics. Even if you don’t tick every box, we encourage you to apply — your unique perspective and experience could be exactly what we need. Be part of a team that values work-life balance, supports your personal well-being, and empowers you to contribute to something truly impactful.

Who we are

Logistics shapes everyday life - from the goods we consume to the healthcare we rely on. At Kuehne+Nagel, your work goes beyond logistics; it enables both ordinary and special moments in the lives of people around the world.

As a global leader with a strong heritage and a vision to move the world forward, we offer a safe, stable environment where your career can make a real difference. Whether we help deliver life-saving medicines, develop sustainable transportation solutions or support our local communities, your career will contribute to more than you can imagine.

We kindly advise that placement agencies refrain from submitting unsolicited profiles. Any submissions of candidates without prior signed agreement will be considered our property and no fees will be paid.
Show more

Title: Engenheiro(a) de I&D – Física | Software | Eletrónica
Description:
Sobre a Sarspec

Somos uma empresa portuguesa dedicada ao desenvolvimento e comercialização de Instrumentação Analítica, com especialização em Espetroscopia, atuando no mercado nacional e internacional. Procuramos reforçar a nossa equipa de Investigação e Desenvolvimento com profissionais talentosos e motivados, que queiram contribuir para o desenvolvimento de soluções inovadoras.




Procuramos candidatos com formação em:

Engenharia Física / Engenharia Informática / Engenharia Eletrotécnica (ou equivalente)




Para perfis de Engenharia Física:

Bases sólidas em espetroscopia: conceitos, instrumentação e aplicações

Preferencialmente com conhecimentos em desenho ótico e/ou eletrónico

Conhecimentos sólidos em programação em Python




Para perfis de Software:

Bons conhecimentos de Programação Orientada a Objetos

Raciocínio lógico e facilidade em desenvolver algoritmos robustos

Conhecimentos em linguagens de programação: Java; C/C++; Python




Para perfis de Eletrónica:

Conhecimentos de eletrónica analógica e digital.

Experiência em desenho de PCB's multilayer utilizando ferramentas como Altium, KiCad, ou Eagle.

Experiência com sistemas embebidos (ex.: Arduino, Raspberry Pi, etc.)

Experiência no desenvolvimento de protótipos eletrónicos.

Preferencialmente com conhecimentos em programação em Python.




Outras caraterísticas de igual importância:

Capacidade de adaptação, criatividade e organização

Espírito crítico e atenção ao detalhe

Profissionalismo e assiduidade




Oferecemos:

Integração numa equipa multidisciplinar e especializada

Participação em projetos desafiantes com impacto real na área científica

Ambiente de trabalho positivo, cooperativo e inovador

Oportunidade de desenvolvimento técnico e científico contínuo

Show more

Title: Python Rockstar Developer
Description:
We’re looking for bright Python Rockstar Developers to join our team




Join Critical TechWorks as a Python Developer and be part of our dynamic team driving the digital transformation in the automotive landscape for BMW Group's future driving machines. In this role, you'll be more than just a coder; you'll be a problem-solver, planner, and doer, bringing energy and star-quality to crafting high-quality, reliable software components for a variety of groundbreaking projects.




Framework Development: Engage in developing frameworks to facilitate integration testing for various communication protocols, ensuring seamless interactions within complex systems.
Automation and Testing: Craft and enhance automation frameworks for comprehensive testing, including hardware, software, and model-in-the-loop scenarios, to ensure robustness and reliability.
Scripting and Configuration: Regularly develop Python scripts for Linux environments, focusing on configuring the integration of a diverse range of tools within the CI/CD pipeline.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with other teams, including development, testing, and operations, to understand requirements and deliver effective solutions.
Quality and Reliability: Apply rigorous testing and quality assurance practices to maintain high standards in all software components, contributing to the overall reliability of the systems.
Innovative Solutions: Contribute to the development of innovative solutions in areas like framework development for integration testing, enhancing the efficiency and effectiveness of testing processes.




This is a Rockstar Developer role, our take on the classic Software Developer.

Standing as the brick-and-mortar of Critical TechWorks, it plays a crucial role in designing, developing, building, testing, deploying, and maintaining our product. You can find out more - and check other Development vacancies - at this link.




Whatever you’re working on, here’s the lowdown on the technical skills you’re likely to have:

Proven experience developing in Python.
Experience developing scripting for Linux.
Experience with other scripting languages (preferably Shell).
Experience with version control tools (preferably Git).




CTW's Daily Toolkit




Apart from great technical skills, our environment is fast-paced and 100% agile, and prioritizes autonomy, teamwork, interaction and resilience. This means our Python Developers must also possess the following:

Embrace agile and its implementation frameworks namely Scrum, to make the most out of all its events and work to keep evolving a high-performing team.
Be available to be a cross-functional team member by using and developing new skills and enabling a fully responsible team able to cover the whole product lifecycle.
Use standard software engineering practices and tools like version control, IDEs, data dashboards, to manage and keep a systematic and organized development process.
Use state of the art DevOps quality practices and tools such as Continuous Integration /Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines to build, analyse, perform automated testing and deployment processes, to ensure a streamlined and reliable development workflow.
Run and operate developed software inside and outside working hours if needed, to provide high quality software services (extra compensation will be applicable).
Be available to travel abroad for short periods, as required to support all the phases of the product development cycle when needed.
Have excellent English oral and written skills. German communication skills will be a plus.




Who we are




Critical TechWorks seeks a distinct and treasured corporate culture, that is very much our own. This means:

Growth and Innovation: Be a key player in shaping the future of mobility through innovative ideas.
Engineering Excellence: Immerse yourself in an environment valuing engineering process, where we create, innovate, lead, and make a tangible impact.
Autonomy and Collaboration: Thrive in a culture that blends autonomy with teamwork, contributing to groundbreaking developments.
Continuous Learning: Embrace constant skill enhancement in a dynamic workplace, where your contributions impact cutting-edge technology projects.




Join Critical TechWorks on our journey of innovation, excellence, and redefining the future of motion, one product at a time.




At Critical Techworks we are creating an inclusive culture that values our people’s different viewpoints and experiences, regardless of sexual orientation, gender identity, age, color, ethnicity, religion, or disability.

Show more

Title: Junior Software Frontend Engineer (Remote Friendly)
Description:
Junior Software Frontend Engineer (Remote Friendly)




📍 Location: Braga, Portugal (Remote friendly). You must reside in Portugal.




We're hiring a Junior Software Frontend Engineer with a focus on web development to join our team at WIP Technology Centre in Braga, Portugal! We're looking for a proactive and supportive team player with up to two years of experience who is passionate about technology.




This is a remote-friendly position, but the initial three-month onboarding will be face-to-face at our Braga office.




🧑‍💻 About the Role:




Collaborate with our research and development team on web-based software.
Focus on frontend development, with room to explore backend technologies.
Build clean and maintainable user interfaces using modern frameworks.
Participate in product and development meetings.
Document technical flows using diagrams and flowcharts.




✅ What we're looking for




Requirements:




Experience with JavaScript and/or TypeScript, HTML5, and CSS3
Familiarity with React, ideally with Next.js or Vite
Solid understanding of object-oriented programming




Nice-to-Have:




Familiarity with Git, Docker, and transport protocols (HTTP, messaging, etc.)
Exposure to SQL/NoSQL databases
Experience with PHP/Laravel
Understanding of REST APIs




💬 Soft Skills:




Strong communication in English (oral and written)
Team-oriented and proactive mindset
Enthusiastic about learning and sharing knowledge




🎓 Education:




Degree in Information Technology or a related field (or equivalent experience)




🎁 Perks & Benefits:




Remote-friendly work setup (after onboarding)
Flexible hours and creative freedom
Young, friendly, startup-style environment
Health insurance
Birthday leave 🎂
Salary: €16,500 – €20,000 gross annually

Title: Automation Developer
Description:
We want to do different with the essential’s things.

We are committed to a sustainable corporatism strategy. We believe that success is based on building a team focused on collective well-being, personal and professional development, and based on a work philosophy that enhances the healthy management of our lives. Work-life balance, beginner’s mind and community involvement are our identity, our foundations, and our culture.




What you need to join us:




- Minimum 2 years of professional experience as Automation Framework Developer;

- Experience in design and building software or tools;

- Understanding of end-to-end testing processes and methodologies;

- Experience in Jenkins, GIT, Ansible, and Linux;

- Experience with Python, Java, C# or C++;

- Advanced English level;




Important notes:

- It’s a hybrid project in Porto.







What do we have to offer you:




- Personalized Talent Management. We value and privilege a close and regular follow-up; we are a team from day one.

- Broad and flexible benefits package. Health insurance, life and personal accident insurance, discounts and benefits, telecommunications plan and much more.

- We invest in training and in your career. Certified training, online training platforms, Pearson VUE exam center... We bet on you!

- Sustainability and community involvement. We want to give meaning to our work and invest in an inclusive consulting project. For that, we need your help.




team.it, back to basics!

Will you join us?







At Team IT we defend equality and value diversity.

We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit.

All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

Title: Frontend React Developer @Braga
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Mid/Senior Frontend React Developer

Seniority: +3 years

Type of position: HYBRID (at Braga, 2x/week)




The amazing you, will have:

3+ years of experience in frontend development with React.js.
Strong proficiency in Next.js for server-side rendering (SSR) and static site generation (SSG).
Expertise in TypeScript for building type-safe applications.
Solid understanding of modern CSS (e.g., Tailwind CSS, Styled Components, CSS Modules) and responsive design.
Experience with state management solutions such as Redux, Zustand, or Recoil.
Familiarity with API integrations (REST, GraphQL) and data fetching strategies.
Knowledge of performance optimization techniques and best practices.
Experience with testing frameworks (Jest, React Testing Library, Cypress, etc.).
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a collaborative environment.
Fluency in Portuguese is MANDATORY.







To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you´ll have (plus):

Related certifications.




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

  • You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
  • Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
  • Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
  • International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
  • Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
  • In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
  • Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
  • Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
  • Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!



Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Junior Java Developer
Description:
Join Randstad as a Java Developer Junior. You'll work in a tight team environment. We value cultural fit as much as technical know-how. We are looking for someone who is passionate about programming, enjoys learning, and can bring their skills, and a fresh perspective to a talented team that is always looking to get better. As well as working hard we also have a fun and informal company culture.




Responsabilities




Build Create reusable code and libraries for future use
Deliver backend code that is well designed, testable, and aligned with standards
Integrate IoT devices and software into a complete system
Work closely with other team members.
Assist with daily tasks within the Feature Team.




Skills




Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or related field
+ 2 years of experience in backend development with Java
Knowledge of OOP principles and familiarity with API integration, relational databases, and version control (Git)
Good knowledge of English
Good analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to leverage data to identify trends, opportunities, and risks, with experience with products in quality and production environment
A team player with good interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to multitask effectively in a fast-paced environment




Benefits




Join our digital team and be part of the technological transformation shaping the future.

Apply now and start making a difference today.

Title: Engenheiro QA
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation, and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?




Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

Developing projects in the most diverse industries – Banking, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation, among others –, we have created an environment where the brightest enquiring minds feel at home, providing our people with the means, opportunities and support they need to thrive and innovate.




We are seeking a skilled QA Engineer eager to take on new challenges in a hybrid work model in Porto.




Are you the one?




Experience in test automation and/or development
Ability to analyze requirements and define test strategies
Knowledge of automation tools (e.g., Katalon, Cucumber, Cypress is a plus)
Experience with REST API, Web UI, and regression testing
Basic coding skills (Java, Groovy)
Familiar with CI/CD tools: Jenkins, Git, Bitbucket, Windows Server
Strong SQL and database knowledge (SGBD)
Comfortable with command line, batch processes, and browser drivers
Understanding of HTML, CSS, and web technologies
Experience with JIRA, Xray
Agile mindset and team collaboration
Strong communication skills, autonomy, and problem-solving ability




We believe we are the ones to, by:

Providing a multidisciplinary Team.
Giving a home office kit with everything you need to perform remotely.
Ensuring a career plan alongside professional growth.
Providing you with a custom training plan.
Helping you reach happiness.




Oh… and by the way, we also have:

Several challenging complex projects.
Stimulating teams and leaders.
World-class Clients and Partners.




If you believe in this match as much as we do, send us your CV to catarina.rolo@closer.pt and reach the closer side of life.




Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics.




At Closer, we embrace the unique perspectives and experiences that everyone brings, and we believe that it is a fundamental driver for the success we've achieved.

Title: Software QA Engineer
Description:
Our client is a leading provider of secure identity management solutions for governmental clients worldwide. They specialize in developing and delivering innovative platforms for biometric passports, ID cards, and related services. Their mission is to provide reliable, scalable, and secure solutions that meet the highest standards of quality and performance.

We are looking for a detail-oriented and quality-driven Software QA Engineer to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for planning, developing, executing, and maintaining test strategies and test cases across all stages of the software development lifecycle. This role is key to ensuring the delivery of high-quality identity management products to our clients.

Key Responsibilities:


Test Planning & Strategy:
Define, implement, and maintain QA processes, test plans, and test cases.
Analyze requirements and collaborate with business analysts, developers, and product managers to understand features and define testing scope.
Test Execution & Reporting:
Perform manual and automated testing for web, API, and backend services.
Track and report bugs, and work with development teams to ensure timely resolution.
Validate defect fixes and maintain regression test suites.
Test Automation:
Develop and maintain automated test scripts using industry-standard tools.
Contribute to the continuous integration pipeline by integrating automated test suites.
Compliance & Security Testing:
Ensure compliance with quality standards including ISO/IEC 27001, OWASP, and GDPR
Conduct functional, performance, security, and user acceptance testing. 5. Collaboration & Continuous Improvement:
Participate in agile ceremonies and contribute to sprint reviews, retrospectives, and planning sessions.
Continuously improve testing methodologies, documentation, and coverage.


Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field
Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in software quality assurance
Proficiency in writing and executing manual and automated test cases
Experience with QA tools such as Selenium, JMeter, Postman, TestRail, or similar
Familiarity with REST APIs, databases (e.g., PostgreSQL), and version control systems (e.g., Git)
Understanding of software development methodologies including Agile/Scrum
Excellent attention to detail and strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Effective written and verbal communication skills in English
Knowledge of biometric or identity management solutions is a plus
Show more

Title: React Native Developer
HTML:
Com mais de 7 anos de existência a nível nacional, contamos com mais de 200 colaboradores com o nosso ADN e posicionamo-nos no mercado com 3 ofertas de serviço:


  • Strategy (Outsourcing, NeXel, Team as a Service, Tech Academies);
  • R&D (Estágios, POC, Laboratório Tecnológico);
  • Nearshore.


Na ADENTIS centramo-nos nas PESSOAS e é este o nosso salário emocional:


  • Equilíbrio entre a vida profissional e pessoal;
  • Flexibilidade na rotina organizacional;
  • Benefícios de saúde para colaboradores e familiares;
  • Eventos Team Building;
  • Protocolo com mais de 300 parceiros;
  • Formação contínua através de um centro profissional de formação e certificação;
  • Acompanhamento e feedback contínuo através de um plano personalizado;
  • Progressão de carreira através de avaliações objetivas e diretas.



O que procuramos:


  • Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática ou similar;
  • Experiência superior a 2 anos em desenvolvimento mobile com React Native (Android);
  • Proeficiência em Javascript/Typescript;
  • Experiência em Git;
  • Experiência a trabalhar em equipas agile;
  • Experiência com ferramentas de observabilidade - PLUS;
  • Bom nível de inglês falado e escrito.



O que valorizamos:


  • Experiência com Kotlin.




Se queres fazer parte de uma empresa People First, junta-te a nós.


We walk with you!



Na Adentis defendemos a igualdade e valorizamos a diversidade. Criamos um ambiente seguro, diversificado e onde as oportunidades são iguais para todos os colaboradores!

Não discriminamos com base em idade, etnia, orientação sexual, género, deficiência ou qualquer fator que não seja o mérito.

Todas as candidaturas com competências para o cargo são bem-vindas!

Title: Lead Python Developer
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Lead Python Developer for a hybrid position (Porto).




Key Responsibilities:

• Implement Test Driven Development (TDD) to ensure high code quality and reliability.

• Drive continuous improvement initiatives, focusing on DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines.

• Conduct refactoring efforts while adhering to simple design principles and clean architecture.

• Foster collaboration through pair programming, daily standups, code reviews, sprint reviews, and retrospectives.

• Design and maintain resilient architectures that support scalability and performance.

• Utilize Django framework for backend development.




Qualifications:

• Proven experience as a Lead Developer with a strong focus on Python.

• In-depth knowledge of Test Driven Development (TDD).

• Familiarity with DevOps practices, CI/CD tools, and methodologies.

• Expertise in refactoring, simple design, and clean architecture principles.

• Experience with agile methodologies and team collaboration practices.

• Proficiency in Django framework.




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to estefania.rodrigues@decskill.com




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.The ideal candidate will be responsible for creating, installing and managing our databases. You will ensure optimal database performance by analyzing database issues and monitoring database performance.
